Class Google::Line
In: slices/google_maps/google/line.rb
Parent: MapObject

Represents a polyline that can be added to a Map using Map#add_line. If a method or event is not documented here please see googles online docs for details. See MapObject#listen_to on how to use events not listed on this object.

Examples:

 Google::Line.new :vertices => [{:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462},
                                {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462},
                                {:latitude => -33.999, :longitude => 18.472}]

 Google::Line.new :from => {:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462},
                  :to => {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462}

 Google::Line.new :from => {:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462},
                  :to => {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462},
                  :colour => 'red', :thickness => 20

 # Adding a line betweem markers
 markers = map.add_markers({:location => {:latitude => -33.958, :longitude => 18.462}},
                           {:location => {:latitude => -33.987, :longitude => 18.462}},
                           {:location => {:latitude => -33.999, :longitude => 18.472}})

 Google::Line.new :between_markers => markers, :colour => 'red', :thickness => 10

Encoding examples:

 # Encoded line with default styling
 Google::Line.new :encoded => {:points => 'ihglFxjiuMkAeSzMkHbJxMqFfQaOoB', :levels => 'PFHFGP',
                               :num_levels => 18, :zoom_factor => 2}

 # Encoded line with styling
 Google::Line.new :encoded => {:points => 'ihglFxjiuMkAeSzMkHbJxMqFfQaOoB', :levels => 'PFHFGP',
                               :num_levels => 18, :zoom_factor => 2},
                  :colour => 'green', :opacity => 1, :thickness => 10

Public Class methods

new(options = {})

Either vertices, from and to, between_markers or encoded will be used to draw the line.

Options:

  • vertices - Optional. A single location or array of locations representing the vertices of the line.
  • from - Optional. The location where the line begins.
  • to - Optional. The location where the line ends.
  • between_markers - Optional. An array of markers. The line will be drawn between the markers.
  • editable - Optional. Indicates if the line is editable, defaulted to false.
  • tooltip - Optional. See Google::Tooltip#new for valid options.

Encoded options

  • encoded - Optional. A single hash or array of hashes with the below options, which represent encoded polylines.
    • points - A string containing the encoded latitude and longitude coordinates.
    • levels - A string containing the encoded polyline zoom level groups
    • num_levels - The number of zoom levels contained in the encoded levels option.
    • zoom_factor - The magnification between adjacent sets of zoom levels in the encoded levels option.

Styling options

  • colour - Optional. The colour of the line, can be a name(‘red’, ‘blue’) or a hex colour.
  • thickness - Optional. The thickness of the line in pixels.
  • opacity - Optional. The opacity of the line between 0 and 1.

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/line.rb, line 65
 65:     def initialize(options = {})
 66:       options.default! :var => 'line', :vertices => [], :editable => false
 67: 
 68:       super
 69: 
 70:       if create_var?
 71:         self.encoded = options.extract(:encoded)
 72:         
 73:         unless self.encoded?
 74:           options[:vertices] << options.extract(:from) if options[:from]  
 75:           options[:vertices] << options.extract(:to) if options[:to]
 76: 
 77:           if markers = options[:between_markers]
 78:             markers.each do |marker|
 79:               options[:vertices] << marker.location
 80:             end
 81:           end
 82: 
 83:           self.vertices = options.extract(:vertices).arify.collect do |vertex| 
 84:                                                                      Google::OptionsHelper.to_location(vertex)
 85:                                                                    end
 86:         end
 87:         
 88:         colour =  options.extract(:colour) 
 89:         thickness =  options.extract(:thickness) 
 90:         opacity =  self.get_opacity(options.extract(:opacity))
 91: 
 92:         if self.encoded?
 93:           encoded_options = self.encoded.merge(:color => colour, :weight => thickness, :opacity => opacity)
 94:           encoded_argument = Google::OptionsHelper.to_encoded_polyline(encoded_options)
 95:           self << "#{self.var} = new GPolyline.fromEncoded(#{encoded_argument});"
 96:         else
 97:           self << "#{self.var} = new GPolyline([#{self.vertices.join(', ')}], #{colour.to_js}, #{thickness.to_js}, #{opacity.to_js});"
 98:         end
 99: 
100:         self.enable_editing! if options[:editable] == true
101: 
102:         tooltip_options = options.extract(:tooltip)
103:         self.set_tooltip(tooltip_options) if tooltip_options
104:       end
105:     end

Public Instance methods

add_vertex(location)

Adds a vertex at the given location and updates the shape of the line. location can be a Location or whatever Location#new supports

[Source]

This event is fired when the line has been edited.

Yields:

  • script - A JavaScriptGenerator to assist in generating javascript or interacting with the DOM.

length(format = :meters)

The length of the line along the surface of a spherical earth. The format can be meters or kilometers, defaulted to meters.

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/line.rb, line 116
116:     def length(format = :meters)
117:       length = "#{self.var}.getLength()"
118:       length = "#{length} / 1000" if format == :kilometers
119: 
120:       length
121:     end
mouse_off(&block)

This event is fired when the mouse "moves off" the line.

Yields:

  • script - A JavaScriptGenerator to assist in generating javascript or interacting with the DOM.

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/line.rb, line 164
164:     def mouse_off(&block)
165:       self.listen_to :event => :mouseout, &block
166:     end
mouse_over() {|script, :mouse_location| ...}

This event is fired when the mouse "moves over" the line.

Yields:

  • script - A JavaScriptGenerator to assist in generating javascript or interacting with the DOM.
  • mouse_location - The location at which the mouse cursor is hovering within the polygon.

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/line.rb, line 152
152:     def mouse_over(&block)
153:       self.listen_to :event => :mouseover do |script|
154:         script << "mouse_location = last_mouse_location;"
155: 
156:         yield script, :mouse_location
157:       end
158:     end
style=(options)

Changes the style of the line.

Options:

  • colour - Optional. The colour of the line, can be a name(‘red’, ‘blue’) or a hex colour.
  • thickness - Optional. The thickness of the line in pixels.
  • opacity - Optional. The opacity of the line between 0 and 1.

Examples:

  line.style = {:colour => 'red', :thickness => 12}
  line.style = {:colour => '#aaa', :thickness => 20, :opacity => 1}

[Source]

     # File slices/google_maps/google/line.rb, line 133
133:     def style=(options)
134:       stroke_style_options = {}
135:       stroke_style_options[:color] = options.extract(:colour) if options[:colour]
136:       stroke_style_options[:weight] = options.extract(:thickness) if options[:thickness]
137: 
138:       stroke_style_options.merge! options
139:       
140:       self << "#{self.var}.setStrokeStyle(#{stroke_style_options.to_google_options});"
141:     end
